Market Summary
 „ÉªBTC saw violent weekend price action on thin liquidity: a dump from 89.7k to 87.7k (triggering $171M in long liquidations), followed by a sharp move up from 87.7k to 91.2k (wiping out $75M in shorts). Now consolidating around 90k in a high-volatility range.
 „ÉªIn the last two rate-cut events (Sep 17 and Oct 29), BTC first bounced right after the announcement, then trended down for weeks. For this FOMC as well, it‚Äôs critical to separate ‚Äúthe first reaction‚Äù from ‚Äúwhat happens in the following weeks.‚Äù
 „ÉªFor five straight weeks, crypto sentiment has been stuck in ‚ÄúFear.‚Äù It‚Äôs not just prices‚Äîthis psychological chill is showing up in reduced positioning and weaker spot volumes.
 „ÉªBinance Proof of Reserves shows BTC balances up by +23,768 BTC, while ETH and USDT are down. Capital is rotating out of stables and ETH and into BTC directly ‚Äì a classic bull-market style flow.
 „ÉªETH, however, leads all assets in net inflows over the past month at roughly $4.7B. Even though price is still around the low 3Ks, flow data alone would suggest ‚ÄúETH as the next main character.‚Äù
 „ÉªGlobal BTC treasuries held by governments, corporations, and funds have now surpassed 4 million BTC. BTC is steadily shifting from a ‚Äúretail speculation asset‚Äù into a ‚Äústrategic asset for states and institutions.‚Äù
 „ÉªIn Korea, regulators are moving to impose ‚Äúbank-level, no-fault liability‚Äù on exchanges after the Upbit hack‚Äîrequiring user compensation regardless of fault. User protection is entering a new phase in Asia as well.
 „ÉªIn the EU, one year after MiCA took effect, euro-pegged stablecoins have doubled in market cap and now see $3.83B in monthly volume. Clear rules have actually accelerated market growth‚Äîa textbook case of regulation as a growth enabler.

On-chain & Technical Trends
 „ÉªOnly 8.7% of all ETH now sits on centralized exchanges, the lowest share since Ethereum launched in 2015. With CEX balances at 10-year lows, supply is extremely thin and any demand comeback could spark a sharp squeeze higher.
 „ÉªETH has been quietly stacking up via net inflows and treasury accumulation, while the Fusaka upgrade pushed new contract deployments to an all-time high, 28% above the previous peak. Mid-term fundamentals are clearly bullish.
 „ÉªBTC‚Äôs SOPR ratio (LTH/STH) has dropped to 1.35, the lowest level this year. The 12.6k ‚Üí 80k-range drawdown has largely flushed out heavy long-term profit-taking and distribution.
 „ÉªBitcoin Archive notes that the hash ribbon has flipped bearish while short-term holder (STH) NUPL has turned negative. Historically, this ‚Äúminers + STH capitulating at the same time‚Äù pattern often appears near macro bottom zones.
 „ÉªRealized price across almost all long-term UTXO age bands has been rising since mid-October. This means LTHs are taking profits on some cheap coins while the cost basis of what they keep is trending higher‚Äîa healthy form of capital rotation.
 „ÉªOn the derivatives side, BTC sits near 90k, but Binance futures Z-score has dropped to ‚àí1.48, signaling volumes well below the monthly average. It‚Äôs an up-move with weak momentum and shrinking leverage.
 „ÉªAt the same time, the position map shows that a move to 93k could liquidate about $1B in shorts, and a spike to 100k could nuke roughly $9.1B. The ‚Äúshort squeeze trigger‚Äù is heavily primed.
 „ÉªSpot volumes across major exchanges (Binance, Bybit, OKX, etc.) have decelerated into November, while futures still account for ~75% of total market volume. Binance‚Äôs spot/futures ratio has fallen to 0.23. Price discovery is now almost entirely derivatives-driven.

Sentiment
 „ÉªFear & Greed has stayed in ‚ÄúFear‚Äù territory for five weeks. With repeated liquidation waves and ongoing rumors of fund blowups, many now say ‚Äúthis 126k ‚Üí 80k correction is not a normal dip.‚Äù
 „ÉªWithin just four hours over the weekend, $171M in longs and $75M in shorts were wiped out‚Äîa textbook ‚Äúthin liquidity + leverage hunt‚Äù move. In this kind of market, the real edge is not trying to fight back with leverage at all.
 „ÉªCoin Bureau suggests 2025 may be a ‚Äúsideways year‚Äù rather than a crash year, with any major downside more likely pushed into 2026. The idea is that the market is taking its time to construct the next cycle, in a kind of ‚Äúboring bull‚Äù mode.
 „ÉªTom Lee has floated a long-term ETH target around $62,000. Many analysts also note that ETH has not yet experienced a true ‚Äúglobal liquidity blow-off top‚Äù this cycle. From a cycle perspective, the real mania may still be ahead.
 „ÉªSearch interest for ‚Äúdollar debasement‚Äù has hit an all-time high, just as BTC and gold both tagged fresh ATHs. The ‚Äúdollar debasement trade‚Äù is clearly moving from theory into behavior, with capital shifting into value-preserving assets.
 „ÉªRegional flow data shows the current BTC market is ‚ÄúU.S.-only‚Äù on the buy side: the U.S. remains net long, while Europe and Asia have flipped to net selling. This U.S.-centric structure is supportive but also fragile from a sentiment standpoint.
 „ÉªIn TradFi, Netflix‚Äôs potential $83B acquisition of Warner Bros and a surge in bankruptcies in non-AI sectors show that the old economy is in an intense shake-out, even as AI stocks and select crypto names rip higher. The risk-on structure is highly uneven.
 „ÉªVanguard, once one of the loudest BTC skeptics, now offers Bitcoin ETFs on its own platform. When even the harshest critics adopt, it becomes harder to construct a truly bearish long-term argument.

U.S. Traditional Markets
 „ÉªThis week is a ‚Äúsuper week‚Äù for markets: JOLTS, the FOMC rate cut decision, Powell‚Äôs press conference, and jobless claims‚Äîall in a few days. The cut itself is mostly priced in; what matters is not ‚Äúwhat they do‚Äù but ‚Äúhow Powell talks about it.‚Äù
 „ÉªAccording to The Kobeissi Letter, the Fed‚Äôs balance sheet shrinkage during QT (3 years and 5 months) has totaled $2.43T, unwinding 51% of the pandemic-era QE expansion. As of December 1, QT officially ended, opening the door to potential liquidity expansion ahead.
 „ÉªBank of America sees a high probability that the Fed announces ‚ÄúReserve Management Purchases‚Äù at this FOMC‚Äîeffectively a light version of QE aimed at boosting bank reserves and easing funding stress. That would be a structurally bullish signal for risk assets.
 „ÉªOn the flip side, 717 large U.S. companies have gone bankrupt this year, the highest in 15 years. Many of these failures are in areas not benefiting from AI, highlighting the ‚Äúinvisible pain‚Äù spreading beneath the surface of headline indices.
 „ÉªThe U.S. Treasury Secretary is guiding to 3% GDP growth for 2025‚Äîa notably optimistic projection. Meanwhile JPMorgan‚Äôs Jamie Dimon openly criticizes Europe for driving out business, investment, and innovation. Capital flows between regions are becoming more polarized.
 „ÉªJapan‚Äôs 30-year JGB yield is spiking, but the VIX remains calm. There‚Äôs no obvious sign yet of a violent carry-trade unwind or yen spike, but this combination is a ‚Äúquiet warning‚Äù that something may be starting to move.
 „ÉªChina has added gold for 13 consecutive months, buying another 30k troy ounces in November and taking holdings to 74.12M ounces. Many countries are rebalancing their reserves away from the dollar and into value-preserving assets like gold and BTC.
 „ÉªCZ has called on governments to record all public spending on blockchains as an incorruptible public ledger. At the same time, U.S. regulators are discussing both ‚Äúfull market on-chain infrastructure‚Äù and potential sovereign BTC accumulation. The financial infrastructure itself is starting to shift.

Overall Assessment
In the short term, the market remains in a high-volatility environment driven by thin liquidity and leverage hunts, routinely flushing out both long and short positions. At the same time, ETH‚Äôs historic exchange outflows, Fusaka-driven on-chain activity, the end of Fed QT with talk of reserve purchases, 4M BTC held in treasuries, and full adoption of BTC ETFs by giants like Vanguard all point to a strengthening mid- to long-term fundamental and supply-demand backdrop.
Today‚Äôs XWIN TREND INDEX is 68 / 100, with a directional bias of ‚ÄúMild uptrend.‚Äù
Looking one month ahead, this week‚Äôs FOMC and Powell‚Äôs remarks could be a turning point for the key trio of ‚Äúrates, dollar, and liquidity.‚Äù In the last two rate-cut events, the pattern was ‚Äúshort-term bounce, then weeks of downside,‚Äù so once again the priority should be preparation, not prediction. The base case strategy is: keep leverage minimal, accumulate spot BTC, ETH, and select L1s in steps, and watch ETH flows, BTC ETF flows, and U.S. capital movements‚Äîas well as post-FOMC volatility‚Äîfor opportunities on both pullbacks and short-covering rallies. It is a phase for a slightly bullish stance, but with risk management clearly taking priority.
